standard.description: These are best practices that apply to Universal Theme applications.

test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when aapb.button_name = 'DELETE'
                         then case when aapb.button_template_options not like '%danger%'
                                   then 'DANGER-DELETE'
                                   end
                         when aapb.button_name = 'CREATE'
                         then case when aapb.display_position_code = 'NEXT' and aa.theme_number = 1000
                                   then 'NEXT-CREATE'
                                   end
                         when aapb.icon_css_classes like 'fa-%'
                         then case when aa.theme_number = 1000
                                   then 'WRONGLIBRARY'
                                   when aapb.icon_css_classes like '%anim%'
                                   then 'BUTTON-ANIM'
                                   end
                         end child_code,
                    aapb.workspace, 
                    aapb.application_id, 
                    aapb.page_id, 
                    aapb.button_name, 
                    aapb.button_template_options,
                    aapb.button_id component_id,
                    aapb.last_updated_by, 
                    aapb.last_updated_on,
                    aa.theme_number,
                    aapb.display_position_code,
                    aapb.icon_css_classes
            from apex_application_page_buttons aapb
            inner join apex_applications aa on aapb.application_id = aa.application_id
						where aapb.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE'))
select case when std.child_code is not null 
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 'The `%0` button (app %1, page %2) %3.', 
                          p0 => std.button_name, 
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => case std.child_code 
                                     when 'DANGER-DELETE'
                                     then 'should be styled as "Danger". It currently has the following styling :`'||std.button_template_options||'`'
                                     when 'NEXT-CREATE'
                                     then 'should be placed in the `NEXT` position. It is currently in the following position: `'||std.display_position_code||'`'
                                     when 'BUTTON-ANIM'
                                     then 'has an animation. Please eliminate'
                                     when 'WRONGLIBRARY'
                                     then 'is using an invalid `Universal Theme` icon (`'||std.icon_css_classes||'`). You must use a `Redwood` icon'
                                     end) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 'The `%0` button (app %1, page %2) is incorrectly styled', 
                          p0 => std.button_name, 
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id)  
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
		 std.button_name, 
     std.button_template_options,
     std.component_id,
     std.display_position_code,
     null parent_component_id,
     std.theme_number,
     std.icon_css_classes,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Buttons should be styled and placed correctly according to their function :

*   BUTTON-ANIM : Including icons is fine (even encouraged). Icon placement should always be on the left. Adding animated icons (assigning a fa-anim-... class to an icon) is strongly discouraged. It's not the early 90's and this is not a geocities website.
*   DANGER-DELETE : Delete buttons should always styled as "Danger", and far away from the primary action.
*   NEXT-CREATE : Cancel button should be left-most button in the NEXT button position.
*   WRONGLIBRARY : You cannot use \`Universal Theme\` icons (the fa-fa icons) in \`Redwood\`.
test.fix:
*   BUTTON-ANIM : Remove the animation
*   DANGER-DELETE : Add the Danger style to the button
*   NEXT-CREATE : Reposition the button
*   WRONGLIBRARY : Use a Redwood icon
